items.title: ‘Don’t sell just because there’s a bubble,’ says Ray Dalio, but be prepared for low returns over be next 10 years
items.description: "I think the picture is pretty clear in that we are in that territory of a bubble, but we don't have the pricking of the bubble yet," Dalio said.

items.title: Skims founding partner Emma Grede schedules an ‘AI day’ once every six weeks to future-proof her career: ‘It’s like do or die’
items.description: Upskilling in AI is unavoidable as workers look to ‘future-proof our organizations and ourselves,’ Grede added.

items.title: Sam Altman’s eye-scanning orb startup says employees should only care about work—for the good of humanity—otherwise ‘you should just not be here’
items.description: “We work weekends, we're always on call, and we push as hard as our circumstances allow us to,” Tools for Humanity CEO Alex Blania said in a January s...

items.title: The IPO market is being re-globalized as Asia’s markets embrace dual listings and corporate governance reform
items.description: Asian companies are increasingly exploring the possibility of listing in non-U.S. markets.

items.title: USA Rare Earth CEO describes ‘Manhattan Project’ to wean U.S. from dependence on China
items.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
